# Question

Write a function `timezone_bumper(dt,bump)` that increases any provided timestamp by `bump::Int` hours (defaults to +3 hours). Make sure it works only for DateTime types and throws an error for Date types.

```julia
function timezone_bumper(dt, bump=3)
    if typeof(dt) == Date
        throw(ArgumentError("The function can process DateTime objects only."))
    end
    return dt + Hour(bump)
end
```

This function uses the `TimeZones` package to add hours (defaulting to 3) to a given datetime object. If an argument of type Date is passed, it throws an error as dates don't have timezones. The `TimeZone` module needs to be imported for this function to work.

Please note that you can extend the function to handle multiple types by adding a series of `elseif` statements. You could also add a catch-all statement to capture and handle unexpected input types.
